intro: Ctenodon brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed ctenodon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
